pr_title: Refactoring the persistence layer to be able to persist any Java Object

timeline.message: Better comments and error message handling

timeline.bodyText:
This read method is not added in the PersistorBase class.
This logic can be moved to the PersistorBase class? It can follow similar structure that write uses. read and readImpl methods. With read implemented in PersistorBase and readImpl in persistors?
timeline.author: sruti1312

replies.bodyText: PersistorBase is supposed to be DB agnostic. So, tomorrow we can have a levelDB persistor instead of SQLite and even then PersistorBase would take care of file rotation and gc etc.
replies.author: yojs

timeline.bodyText: Is this more of an warning?
timeline.author: sruti1312

replies.bodyText: This is error because we don't have have the chained table to completely fill up the Object. We messed up writing data. That's why it is error
replies.author: yojs

timeline.bodyText: Can we add a statement when throwing this. Might be more informative when debugging
timeline.author: sruti1312

replies.bodyText: Good point. In the latest revision, this has been removed.
replies.author: yojs

timeline.bodyText: Quick check if name is not empty and length is more than 1 character?
timeline.author: sruti1312

replies.bodyText: So what this intends to do is convert x to 'X' or 'camelCaseX' to 'CamelCaseX'. So capitalize the first character. Do you mean I should check for this ?
replies.author: yojs

replies.bodyText: Check for length > 1 inorder to avoid IndexOutOfBoundsException
replies.author: sruti1312
yojs

timeline.bodyText: Any reason why this is static? I might be missing something
timeline.author: sruti1312

replies.bodyText: This depends on no member of this class and it does not modify any member of the instance. Therefore, I kept it as static.
replies.author: yojs

timeline.bodyText: Can we rename this class as say PersistorTestExample or MockPersistorInput?
timeline.author: sruti1312

timeline.message: Added test to cover list of ints
Added more comments for readability and addressing PR review comments

timeline.bodyText:
I still think we should not use class name directly as the table name.
For example, if we wants to persist rca flowunit of different types, how are we going to persist them into a same table (i.e. RCA table) ?
This also applies to remediation actions, in that case all remediation actions (cache actions, queue actions) will be persisted into a single table
Or should we create a base class for persister to use in that case ?
timeline.author: rguo-aws

replies.bodyText:
It may not be a good idea to persist two different FLowUnits directly into the same table. These classes can have different Fields or different number of fields, that would throw a DB exception. More checks we have to do, to convert the error messages into understandable ones.
If we at all want to persist two different FlowUnits into the same table, then we should create an Object in both FlowUnits, and that we should ask to persist. That way, at Java level, it will be guranteed to not throw DB exceptions because of schema mismatch.
replies.author: yojs

timeline.bodyText: a high level question I have for this function is, how are we going to handle Enum type ? We have resource enum in ResourceSummary. Can we override this getter / setter to serialize / de-serialize Enum based on enum value ?
timeline.author: rguo-aws

replies.bodyText:
This is an excellent point. Enums are not covered. We will add support for them before we migrate Existing RCAs to be persisted using this new API.
For now this should unblock the persisting the deciders into DB use-case
replies.author: yojs
